title: You guys keep mentioning how you have supports that build Redemption and Locket
body:
You must be pilfering them from my games.

Give them to me.

replies.body:
i honestly dont get why people complain about supports needing to build SS/redemption/locket

what do junglers need to build?  Smite item then a certain subset of tank or dps items

what do adcs build?  IE, Hurricane, BT, and a couple other certain DPS items

this could literally be said about every single class of champion

The problem is that Redemption is a little bit too strong right now.

There's something not normal when even supports like Blitz or Braum, despite having 0 scaling for heal and shield, build this item.

Only {{item:2049}} and a support item should always be build. The rest of your items should be based of the enemy comp/ your comp and who has the most kills on the enemy team.

blitzcrank has his mana shield, which is benefitted by the 10% bonus from redemption and the mana regeneration from it

also, locket and redemption synnergize with themselves, making it rewarding to build both even if you dont have healing or shields like braum

I'm pretty sure building any mana items would be 10 times better that Redemption.

But of course, building Redemption is mostly for the active which is kinda weird considering Blitz playstyle, who want to make 5 vs 4 fight and your team or at least your carries should be feed if you did a good job.

Yes, they do synergize well but it also kills diversity and strategy thinking. If every support, no matter what type , build these items because they are op, there's a problem right here. Especially since, if you don't build them, you are at a disavantage since the other support probably has both items.

well...

If we remove half the combat stats from the jungler item
then remove chilling and challenging smite, 
and then also force you to still get the item before your other items...

you'll cry and QQ on the forums, trust me.

that's like me saying if all of a sudden sight stone was a 0 hp item that was still 800g that supports would still have to buy, you'd bitch.  What's your point exactly?  

Alot of junglers dont upgrade smite till after tiamat+boots anyway, fyi

The only jungler that actually does that build path consistently is Rek'Sai. Maybe you can do it on Rengar and Kha if you get ahead. 

3 junglers is not "a lot", fyi.

It's almost as if he is saying Sightstone gives no benefits other than a pitiful amount of health that supports HAVE to buy in order to play the lane correctly, while Jungle and other roles have items that cost just as much but give combat stats + regen + (in the case of the green jungle upgrade) the same amount of wards as sightstone. 

So, yeah. People would complain if all starting items were the same quality as Sightstone. 

Not hard to comprehend.

Because right now, half the people (maybe an exagerration, but I have no idea) don't even want to support, so they just want to go brand and build like they are mid. I've had both Sona and Soraka players toss an attitude about not having anything support related (past their support gold item) and tell me they can't do damage with a locket, and I die a little inside.

Agreed, but there's no other role dedicated to only assisting the rest of the team. You can still deal damage and provide lots of combat reliability with stuff like Redemption, Ardent Censer, and FQC.
i mean tanks are kinda there to just be the bitch for the team as well <.<
Unless you are Poppy, then you are borderline an Assassin at this point lol

Yyyyes...and no. They can still do their job by providing CC and being a meat wall, all while being a nuisance for the enemy team. A support, however, is necessary not because the team needs another damage-dealer, but for someone to provide utility. Utility comes in the forms of vision, damage mitigation, and a way to reduce the effective damage of the enemy team. If the support isn't able to do that, then they're not -really- doing their job.
what do you have to say to all the sightstone-less lux supports out there?
"pls help. Get a sightstone. We are dying."
Quit being a bitch, spend 800 gold and buy 3 free wards every time you return to base. If you don't, then I want to see your trinket constantly on CD because your two wards are already on the map.

Eh it's a bit more than that. 

Supports tend to be the class of utility. These items are essentially making support a healing/shielding class. There's much more than can be done with the classes items rather than forcing them to be healers to stay relevant.

Other than that, the items are cool. Maybe redemption does a little too much for it's pricetag.
Wow I really want you to detail your idea because it makes no sense to me.

Well, look at the items supports have.

{{item:3504}} Nice passive for buffing someone else, but is locked behind having to heal/shield. 
{{item:3174}} Nearly pointless passive (again based on healing) that requires damage for some reason to be effective. 
{{item:3401}} Just shielding. 
{{item:3109}} Good item, still based in combat sustain.
{{item:3190}} Just shielding, again.
{{item:3222}} Good item, but with randomly tacked on healing/shield power 
{{item:3107}} Way too good for it's cost, especially when other support items tack on loads of healing/shield power.
{{item:2045}} No complaints about it. Just wish people would pick it up more often if they have a lot of actives.
{{item:3060}} Rarely sees use. It's a worse version of ZZ'Rot imo.
{{item:3069}} Great item. I find this to be underrated, I figured it would be a staple support item, but everyone builds frost queen's instead.
{{item:3050}} An OK item. It's strong when it works but most of the time it'll be wasted unless you're really in sync with whoever you've bound. Also, most marksmen tend to have atleast 70%+ crit chance so it gets partially wasted unless you rush it (where it's at it's weakest due to a lack of attack speed/AD).
{{item:3092}} Another great item. Pretty much see this all the time unless it's a tank support that decides to go face instead. 

What you'll actually see in a build now: {{item:2045}} {{item:3107}} {{item:3092}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3117}} + any other item with a shielding/healing bonus. OR sometimes a ZZ'Rot, an item that was designed for splitpushers.

Immediately the builds focus is to heal and shield. And the alternatives are just strictly worse at the moment, so it's EXPECTED to be built if you want to stand a decent chance of winning. Is that not a problem to you? Is that all the support class' items should be based around? One slow and tonnes of healing and shielding?

Why can't there be items that reduce opponents resistances when crowd controlled, or a mini black shield effect, just anything that isn't limited to healing, shielding or movement speed?

Well the fact that those items are op/the best is one thing, the fact that supports help their team with utility and heals/shields is an other thing.

I don't see a problem with the latter and I am more interested in the alternative you think about.
In my opinion, SS is a must, and I'? Mid/support main. Team needs that vision.

Mostly because utility is much more broad for itemization items, and those instant healing/shielding items are overshadowing other utility items. {{item:3050}} {{item:3056}} (not that it was ever popular){{item:3109}} {{item:3800}} (got changed to single guy, but still){{item:3069}} {{item:3222}}

honestly, this just sounds like an argument saying supports items are more diverse/take more thought/more decision making/whatever.

most defensive or offensive items are just that, defensive/offensive stats, and theres very little decision making in what you buy for most champs

As a non support player the support items seem much more... i can't think of a way to word this because i'm half retarded but the support items just seem much more diverse i guess?  that's not even what im trying to say <.<

There is some diversity in the items, but now the focus has been completely shifted to healing and shielding. as VulDread said, it's overshadowing other utility items, shoehorning supports into that particular playstyle.
It's cuz utility isn't really a "stat" and can't be treated as such

You just said it yourself: "Smite item then a certain subset of tank or dps items"

"certain subset of tank or dps items"

"tank _**or**_ dps items"

With supports, there isn't much choice. Tank supports take the combo. Enchanters take the combo. The only ones that don't are mage supports.

ADC building DPS items make them do their job better: sustained DPS.
Frontline building tanky make them do their job better: being tanky.
Supports building Redemption and Locket make them healing and shielding the carry better. But it doesn't help their engage, or peeling enemy off. Right now, support itemization basically makes supports be more like Soraka. We need support items to help them do their job better, whatever that job is.
